intro: Stenomesson viridiflorum var. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf greenflower plant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically green with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
